content.description: Starting on the left-center side of the north face, move up and left using crimps and pinches.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is a big rock in the fall zone, but the holds are fairly positive by then, so it should be okay.
content.location: This is located on the north-east side of the boulder. The downclimb is on the southwest side of the boulder.

content.description: Start matched with hands in the big jug. Cross with the left hand to a sloping pinch. From there, uncross to a right hand crimp, and move up to the next right hand pinch. Utilize positive holds and slopers to get your feet on the ledge to an easy topout.
content.protection: A couple of pads. There's one little rock on the bottom, but a pad should cover it.
content.location:
This starts on the same right hand hold as

Jingo Schism

, located on the center of the north face.

The downclimb is on the south side of the boulder, and there are several easy ways to hop off.

content.description: Start in the center of the north face of the boulder. There is a good, two hand, jug rail in the center (left of the Jingo problems). Move up utilizing sidepulls and positive rails. Once your feet are on the start rail, it's an easy copout.
content.location: It is located on the north face. The downclimb is on the southwest side of the boulder.

content.description:
Jingo Schism climbs a short overhang on friable rock over a good landing.

Sit start with a big left hand incut edge and a smaller right hand incut edge slightly lower on the diagonal rail. From there, work up to the bumps on the mini-shelf, stick a sloping two/three finger dimple, throw a left heel on the shelf out left, crank up to a three finger dimple, then work the remaining edges to reach an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine, the landing is clear but is slightly uneven.
content.location: It climbs the north facing overhang on Runaway Rock.
